data.text:
Heber, Utah is a small city located in Wasatch County. The area has a rich history of religious congregations, with Latter-day Saint churches as the most prominent. There are currently several different churches in Heber that serve to provide spiritual guidance and services for the community. These churches include the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints - Reorganized, Community of Christ, The Church of Jesus Christ (Bickertonites), and New Covenant Church. Each church offers its own unique take on traditional teachings and values, providing people from all walks of life with an opportunity to practice their faith within the supportive atmosphere of a local congregation. Additionally, each church provides various other services such as youth programs and charitable works that benefit those in the community. For many years the churches in Heber have served to strengthen relationships among neighbors and to foster a sense of belonging in this small city.

70.8% of the people in Heber are religious:

- 0.4% are Baptist

- 0.0% are Episcopalian

- 1.7% are Catholic

- 0.0% are Lutheran

- 0.0% are Methodist

- 0.0% are Pentecostal

- 0.0% are Presbyterian

- 68.4% are Church of Jesus Christ

- 0.3% are another Christian faith

- 0.0% are Judaism

- 0.0% are an eastern faith

- 0.0% affilitates with Islam
